instructions.name: STOP - Stop
instructions.description: Suspends the CPU and LCD until a button is pressed.

instructions.name: LD - Load
instructions.description:
LD destination, source
Loads the destination with the value specified by the source.

instructions.name: INC - Increment
instructions.description: Increments the specified value

instructions.name: DEC - Decrement
instructions.description: Decrements the specified value

instructions.name: RLCA - Rotate Left Circular Accumulator
instructions.description: Rotates the accumulator's bits to the left. MSB is moved to the LSB, and also set as the carry flag.

instructions.name: RLA - Rotate Left Accumulator
instructions.description: Rotates the accumulator's bits to the left. MSB is moved to the carry flag, and the LSB is set to the value of the carry flag.

instructions.name: RRCA - Rotate Right Circular Accumulator
instructions.description: Rotates the accumulator's bits to the right. LSB is moved to the MSB, and also set as the carry flag.

instructions.name: RRA - Rotate Right Accumulator
instructions.description: Rotates the accumulator's bits to the right. LSB is moved to the carry flag, and the MSB is set to the value of the carry flag.

instructions.name: ADD - Add
instructions.description: Adds the value of both operands together and stores the result in the first operand.

instructions.name: ADC - Add With Carry
instructions.description: Adds the accumulator, carry flag and the second operand together. Stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: JR - Jump Relative
instructions.description: Jumps to the relative address specified. When a condition is specified, only jumps if the condition is true.

instructions.name: DAA - Decimal Adjust Accumulator
instructions.description: Adjusts the value of the accumulator for BCD addition and subtraction operations.

instructions.name: SCF - Set Carry Flag
instructions.description: Sets the carry flag, clears negative and half-carry flags.

instructions.name: CCF - Complement Carry Flag
instructions.description: Inverts the value of the carry flag. Clears negative and half-carry flags.

instructions.name: CPL - Complement (Accumulator)
instructions.description: Inverts all bits in the accumulator.

instructions.name: HALT - Halt
instructions.description: Halts the CPU until the next interrupt or until reset.

instructions.name: SUB - Subtract
instructions.description: Subtract the value of the second operand from the accumulator and stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: SBC - Subtract With Carry
instructions.description: Subtract the value of the second operand and the carry flag from the accumulator and stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: AND - Bitwise AND
instructions.description: Performs a bitwise AND operation between the operand and the value of the accumulator and stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: OR - Bitwise OR
instructions.description: Performs a bitwise OR operation between the operand and the value of the accumulator and stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: XOR - Bitwise XOR
instructions.description: Performs a bitwise XOR operation between the operand and the value of the accumulator and stores the result in the accumulator.

instructions.name: CP - Compare
instructions.description: The content of the operand is compared with the accumulator (A - operand) and flags are updated.

instructions.name: RET - Return
instructions.description: Returns from a routine called by CALL. When a condition is specified, only returns if the condition is true.

instructions.name: POP - Pop
instructions.description: Pops 2 bytes from the stack, stores them in the operand.

instructions.name: JP - Jump
instructions.description: Jumps to the specified address. When a condition is specified, only jumps if the condition is true.

instructions.name: CALL - Call
instructions.description: Calls a routine. When a condition is specified, only jumps to the routine if the condition is true.

instructions.name: PUSH - Push
instructions.description: Pushes the value of the operand (2 bytes) to the stack.

instructions.name: RST - Restart
instructions.description: Calls the routine defined at the predefined address (operand).

instructions.name: RETI - Return from Interrupt
instructions.description: Returns from an interrupt handler.

instructions.name: EI - Enable Interrupts
instructions.description: Enables interrupts.

instructions.name: DI - Disable Interrupts
instructions.description: Disables interrupts.

instructions.name: LDH - Load High
instructions.description: Reads (or writes) value from "high RAM" at $FFxx, based on the operands.

instructions.name: RLC - Rotate Left Carry
instructions.description: Rotates the operand's bits to the left. MSB is moved to the LSB, and also set as the carry flag.

instructions.name: RRC - Rotate Right Carry
instructions.description: Rotates the operand's bits to the right. LSB is moved to the MSB, and also set as the carry flag.

instructions.name: RL - Rotate Left
instructions.description: Rotates the operand's bits to the left. MSB is moved to the carry flag, and the LSB is set to the value of the carry flag.

instructions.name: RR - Rotate Right
instructions.description: Rotates the operand's bits to the right. LSB is moved to the carry flag, and the MSB is set to the value of the carry flag.

instructions.name: SLA - Shift Left Arithmetic
instructions.description: Shifts content of operand to the left. MSB is moved to the carry flag, LSB is set to 0.

instructions.name: SRA - Shift Right Arithmetic
instructions.description: Shifts content of operand to the right. LSB is moved to the carry flag, MSB does not change.

instructions.name: SRL - Shift Right Logical
instructions.description: Shifts content of operand to the right. LSB is moved to the carry flag, MSB is set to 0.

instructions.name: SWAP - Swap
instructions.description: Swaps the upper and lower nibbles of the operand.

instructions.name: BIT - Test Bit
instructions.description: Tests the specified bit of the specified value. Sets zero flag if bit is clear, clears it if set.

instructions.name: RES - Reset Bit
instructions.description: Clears the specified bit of the operand value.

instructions.name: SET - Set Bit
instructions.description: Sets the specified bit of the operand value.
